title: Mirror Index Pair
description: Given an array of integers, find all pairs of indices (i, j) such that nums[i] equals nums[j], and i is the mirror index of j. The mirror index of k is defined as (n-1-k), where n is the array length. Return all such pairs sorted by increasing index.
inputFormat: First line contains n. Next line contains n integers.
outputFormat: List of pairs [[i, j], ...] in increasing order.

title: Subarray Median Sum
description: For all subarrays of an array with length at least 2, compute the median of each subarray and sum all these medians. Print the resulting sum. Median is the middle value in sorted order or the lower middle for even-length subarrays.
inputFormat: First line n, next line n integers.

title: Shifted Palindrome
description: Determine if a string can be transformed into a palindrome by any number of cyclic shifts (rotations). Print 'true' if possible, otherwise 'false'.
inputFormat: Single string s.

title: Kth Missing Positive XOR
description: Given a sorted array of positive integers and integer k, find the kth missing positive integer for which the XOR of all missing numbers before it is even. Report that number.
inputFormat: First line n and k, next line n sorted positive integers.
outputFormat: The kth missing number satisfying the XOR condition.

title: Matrix Snake Path
description: Given an n x n integer matrix, find the maximum sum of a path from top-left to bottom-right, moving only right or down. The path must alternate between prime and non-prime numbers at each step. If no such path exists, print -1.
inputFormat: First line n, then n lines each with n integers.

title: Balanced Binary Array
description: Given a binary array (only 0s and 1s), find the length of the longest subarray where the number of 0s and 1s is equal.
inputFormat: First line n, second line n space-separated 0 or 1.

title: Unique XOR Path
description: Starting from top-left of an n x m grid of integers, move only right or down to bottom-right. Find the maximum XOR of the values along any such path.
inputFormat: First line n m, then n lines with m integers.
outputFormat: Maximum XOR value over all paths.

title: String Power Subsequence
description: Given a string, determine the length of the longest subsequence where the count of each character is a power of two (eg: 1, 2, 4, 8...).
inputFormat: Single string s.
outputFormat: Length of the longest qualifying subsequence.

title: Alien Dictionary Validator
description: Given an alien alphabet order string and a list of words, determine if these words are sorted lexicographically according to the alien language.
inputFormat: First line alien alphabet string, second line n, then n words.

title: Circular Peak Element
description: Given a circular array, find the index of the first element that is greater than both its neighbors when traversing clockwise. Return -1 if no peak exists.
inputFormat: First line n, second line n integers.

title: Digit Jump Game
description: From index 0 in a string of digits, jump to adjacent indices or any other index that has the same digit. Find the minimum moves to reach the last index.
inputFormat: Single string of digits.

title: XOR-Subarray Balance
description: Find the maximum length subarray where the XOR of its elements equals their sum.
inputFormat: First line n, second line n integers.

title: Tree Equilibrium Split
description: Given a tree with values on each node, determine if any edge removal can split the tree into two subtrees with equal sums. Print true if possible, else false.
inputFormat: First line n, second line n node values, then n-1 edges lines.

title: Rotating Domino Chain
description: Given a list of dominos (a,b pairs), check if by optionally rotating dominos (swapping a and b) they can be arranged in a line where adjacent domino numbers match. Print true if possible, else false.
inputFormat: First line n, next n lines each domino a b.

title: Hidden Mountain Ranges
description: Given an array of altitudes, count the number of 'mountains' where a mountain is a strictly increasing sequence followed by a strictly decreasing sequence of length at least 3.
inputFormat: First line n, second line n integers.

title: Lexicographic Kth Swap
description: Given a string s and an integer k (max 1), perform at most k swaps of any pair of characters to create the lexicographically smallest string possible. Print it.
inputFormat: Line 1 string s, line 2 integer k.
outputFormat: Lex smallest string after up to k swaps.

title: Sliding Window Beauty
description: Given an array nums, for each window of size k, find and print the x-th smallest element in the window. If x exceeds window size, print -1 for that window.
inputFormat: Line 1: n k x; line 2: n integers.
outputFormat: Values for each sliding window separated by spaces.

title: Parity Subarray Counter
description: Count and print the number of subarrays where the count of even and odd numbers is the same.
inputFormat: Line 1: n; line 2: array of n integers.

title: Graph Infection Time
description: In a graph with n nodes, starting from node start, each minute infected nodes infect their neighbors. Determine minimum minutes to infect all nodes, or print -1 if impossible.
inputFormat: Line 1: n start; line 2: m; next m lines edges u v.

title: Prime Segment Split
description: Split an array into the fewest contiguous subarrays such that every subarray's sum is a prime number. If impossible, print -1.
inputFormat: Line 1: n; line 2: n integers.

title: Weighted Jump Array
description: You start at index 0 of an array where each element is max jump length. Jumping to a cell costs its value. Find the minimum total cost to reach the last index.
inputFormat: Line 1: n; line 2: n integers.

title: Array XOR Maze
description: Given an array, at position i you can jump to i+nums[i]. Find the maximum XOR of visited elements from start to last index.
inputFormat: Line 1: n; line 2: array.

title: Diagonal Sum Swap
description: Given a square matrix, you may swap one pair of rows or columns exactly once to maximize the sum of the main diagonal. Print the maximum diagonal sum achievable.
inputFormat: Line 1: n; next n lines: n integers.
outputFormat: Maximum diagonal sum after one swap.

title: Subarray Power Sum
description: Count all subarrays whose sums are powers of two.
inputFormat: Line 1: n; line 2: n integers.

title: Circular Subarray Median
description: For every circular subarray of length k in an array, find its median and sum all medians. Print the total sum.
inputFormat: Line 1: n k; line 2: n integers.
outputFormat: Sum of medians over all circular subarrays.

title: Prefix XOR Count
description: Given an array and integer k, count the number of subarrays whose prefix XOR equals k.
inputFormat: Line 1: n k; line 2: n integers.

title: Diagonal Difference Flip
description: Flip one row or column of a square matrix to get the maximum absolute difference between sums of main and secondary diagonals. Print that maximum difference.
inputFormat: Line 1: n; next n lines: n integers.
outputFormat: Maximum diagonal difference after one flip.

title: Mirror Subsequence
description: Find the length of the longest subsequence which reads the same forward and backward (palindromic subsequence) in a string.
inputFormat: A single string s.

title: Minimum Cost Path with Obstacles
description: Find minimum cost path from top-left to bottom-right in grid, moving right or down through cells with cost except obstacles (-1). Print -1 if no path.
inputFormat: Line 1: n m; next n lines: m integers.

title: Palindrome Partition Count
description: Count different ways to partition a string so each substring is a palindrome. Print the total count.
inputFormat: A single string s.

title: Maximum Product Subarray XOR
description: Given an array of positive integers, find the maximum value obtained by XOR-ing the elements of any subarray multiplied by the subarrayâ€™s length. The subarray must be contiguous.
inputFormat: First line contains n. Next line contains n integers.

title: Graph Max Reach
description: Given a directed graph with n nodes and m edges, find the node from which the maximum number of nodes can be reached (including itself) through directed paths. Print the node number.
inputFormat: First line: n m. Next m lines: edges u v.

title: Tree Path XOR
description: Given a tree with n nodes and values on each node, find the path (any path between any two nodes) that has the maximum XOR value of its node values. Print this maximum XOR.
inputFormat: First line n. Next line n values of nodes. Next n-1 lines edges.

title: Longest Alternating Subarray
description: Find the length of the longest contiguous subarray where the parity of elements alternates (odd, even, odd, even, etc.).
inputFormat: First line n. Second line n integers.
outputFormat: Length of longest alternating parity subarray.

title: Weighted Interval Selection
description: Given a list of intervals with start time, end time, and weight, select a set of non-overlapping intervals with the maximum total weight. Print the maximum total weight.
inputFormat: First line n. Next n lines: start end weight.

title: Subarray Max-Min Difference
description: Count the number of subarrays where the difference between the maximum and minimum element is less than or equal to k.
inputFormat: First line n k. Next line n integers.

title: Circular Tree Diameter
description: Given a tree with n nodes, consider it circular (connect first and last nodes). Find and print the maximum distance between any two nodes in this circular tree.
inputFormat: First line n. Next n-1 lines edges u v.

title: Maximum Submatrix Sum with K
description: Given an n x m matrix and integer k, find the maximum sum submatrix such that the sum is less than or equal to k. Print that maximum sum.
inputFormat: First line n m k. Next n lines each with m integers.

title: Unique Paths with XOR
description: Count the number of paths from the top-left to bottom-right of an n x m grid where the XOR of all visited cells equals a target value. You may only move right or down.
inputFormat: Line 1: n m target. Next n lines: m integers.

title: Max Non-Adjacent Sum Tree
description: In a tree with values on nodes, select a set of nodes with no two nodes adjacent to maximize their value sum. Print the maximum sum.
inputFormat: First line n. Next line values. Next n-1 edges.

title: Weighted Tree Path XOR
description: Given a tree with weighted edges, find the path between any two nodes which has the maximum XOR of its edge weights. Print that maximum XOR value.
inputFormat: First line n. Next n-1 lines contain u v w (edge with weight).

title: Bitmask Hamiltonian Paths
description: Count the number of Hamiltonian paths in a weighted directed acyclic graph using dynamic programming with bitmasking.
inputFormat: First line n m. Next m lines: u v w.

title: 2D Segment Tree Sum Query
description: Implement a 2D segment tree over an n x m matrix to process point updates and submatrix sum queries.
inputFormat: First line n m q. Next n lines: m integers. Next q lines: type x y val (type 1=update, 2=query).
outputFormat: Print results of all type 2 queries.

title: Palindrome Partition with Cost
description: Partition a string into palindromic substrings minimizing the total cost, where the cost of each palindrome substring is the square of its length. Print the minimum total cost.
inputFormat: Single string s.

title: Dynamic MST after Edge Removal
description: Given a graph with edges, compute the MST (minimum spanning tree) weight after removing each edge individually. Print the MST weights or -1 if the graph becomes disconnected.
inputFormat: First line n m. Next m lines: u v w.
outputFormat: Array of MST weights after each edge removal or -1.

title: Maximum XOR Subtree
description: Find the subtree with the maximum XOR among all subtrees of a given tree with node values. Print the maximum XOR value.
inputFormat: First line n. Next line values. Next n-1 edges.

title: Trie Maximum XOR Query
description: Given an array of integers, answer queries asking for the maximum XOR of the query value with any value in the array. Use trie-based data structure for efficient answers.
inputFormat: First line n q. Next line array. Next q lines query values x.

title: DP on Bitmask Traveling Salesman
description: Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP): Given weighted graph, find the minimum cost to visit all nodes starting and ending at the same node using DP with bitmasks.
inputFormat: First line n. Next n lines: n integers (weights).

title: Maximum Flow with Capacity
description: Given a flow network, calculate the maximum flow from source to sink under capacity constraints on edges.
inputFormat: First line n m s t. Next m lines: u v capacity.

title: Kth Shortest Path in DAG
description: In a directed acyclic graph (DAG) with weighted edges, find the length of the Kth shortest path from source to target. If less than K paths exist, print -1.
inputFormat: First line n m s t K. Next m lines: u v w.
outputFormat: Length of Kth shortest path or -1.
